alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 23 at 10:40AM EST until December 23 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CUMBERLAND COUNTY... At 1040 AM EST, The combination of heavy rainfall and anomalously high tide levels will severely impact drainage near the coast in the City of Portland. High tide in Portland is occurring at the moment. Excessive runoff will encounter tidal inundation resulting in backwater and poor drainage. In particular...flooding is possible between Commercial Street and Marginal Way. Rainfall is gradually decreasing in intensity with less than one inch of additional rainfall expected. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall and backwater from anomalously high tides. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas near Portland Harbor. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Portland, South Portland, Falmouth, Cape Elizabeth, Scarborough, and Windham. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
